meanings.sent1: Wearing a helmet can prevent head injuries during biking.
meanings.sent2: Locking the door can prevent burglaries in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape could prevent any harm from reaching him.
meanings.sent4: Her quick reflexes could prevent disaster from striking.
meanings.sent5: The vaccine can prevent the spread of diseases effectively.

meanings.sent1: Regular exercise can prevent weight gain and health issues.
meanings.sent2: Installing a smoke detector can prevent fires in the house.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel tried to prevent the acorns from rolling away.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude can prevent negativity from taking over.
meanings.sent5: Using sunscreen can prevent sunburns and skin damage.

meanings.definition: To hinder or thwart something from occurring
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain could prevent the outdoor event from happening.
meanings.sent2: A strong password can prevent hackers from accessing your accounts.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to prevent the dog from entering the room.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog can prevent drivers from seeing clearly on the road.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise could prevent me from concentrating on my work.
